ai-tha-ap104:1.1_0: “A Buddha praised the appearance of a golden palanquin,
ai-tha-ap104:1.2_0: like a flame in the wind.
ai-tha-ap104:1.3_0: bowing down to the three Vedas,
ai-tha-ap104:3.2_0: Having raised my joined palms to him:
ai-tha-ap104:4.1_0: if he makes his four eons;
ai-tha-ap104:4.3_0: I’m not aware of any living creatures.
ai-tha-ap104:4.4_0: this is the perception of fruit.
ai-tha-ap104:5.1_0: and seven eons have been stored up,
ai-tha-ap104:7.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Vibhaṅga.
ai-tha-ap104:8.1_0: second knowledge of the (whole) knowledge of the Elder Nun Past Wisdom
